image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Georgia; born in Morgan, Calhoun County, Ga., May 31, 1934; educated in the public schools of Morgan; Abraham Baldwin Agricultural College, Tifton, Ga., 1951-1953; Georgia Southern College, Statesboro, Ga., 1953-1956; teacher; businessman; cattle farmer; former administrative assistant to Senator Herman E. Talmadge and Representative G. Elliott Hagan; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-third and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1973-January 3, 1983); was not a candidate in 1982 for reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate for nomination for governor of Georgia; chairman of the board of a governmental relations firm, Alexandria, Va.; died on January 6, 2005, in Augusta, Ga.

researchRecord.name: 1982, 15 commercials on 2 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Bo Ginn's campaign for the 1982 gubernatorial primary and runoff elections in Georgia, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: ca. 1972-1982, 223 boxes.
researchRecord.description: The collection of Robert Bryan (Bo) Ginn consists of committee files, bill files, general office files, press releases, personal and constituent correspondence, and correspondence relating to government agencies and legislation.
